ARABIC: قُلْ إِن كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ وَلَدٌ فَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْعَٰبِدِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'If the All-Merciful had a son, I would be the first to worship him.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Say: "If Ar-Rahman had a son I would have been the first of worshippers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Say: “If the Merciful One had a son, I would have been the first one to worship him.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), say, "Had the Beneficent God really had a son, I would certainly have been the first one to worship him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “If supposedly, the Most Gracious had an offspring* – I would be the first to worship!” (*Which is impossible)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "If the Most Gracious had a son, then I am the first of the worshippers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: If the Beneficent Allah has a son, I am the foremost of those who serve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'If the All-merciful has a son, then I am the first to serve him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say (O Muhammad): If the Beneficent One hath a son, then, I shall be first among the worshippers. (But there is no son).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "If the All Merciful had a son, I would be the first to worship him."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou: had the Compassionate a son, shall be the first of his worshippers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘If the All-beneficent had offspring, I would have been the first to worship [him].’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "If (Allah) Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "If the Most Beneficent (Allah) had a son (or children as you pretend), then I am the first of Allah's worshippers [who deny and refute this claim of yours (and the first to believe in Allah Alone and testify that He has no children)]." [Tafsir At-Tabari].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say (Prophet Muhammad): 'If the Merciful had a son, I would be the first of the worshipers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “If the Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, [O Muhammad], "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of [his] worshippers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:81] Say: ‘If the Compassionate One had a son, hypothetically [speaking], I would have been first among the worshippers, of that son; but it is established that He, exalted be He, does not have a child and thus there can be no worshipping of such [a child].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) Muhammad to al-Nadr Ibn al-Harith and 'Alqamah: (The Beneficent One hath no son. I am first among the worshippers) I am the first to acknowledge that Allah has no son or partner.
